column4: i have a tough one for the experts tonight. i have usb hpna not connecting online. netwk shw ip, netmask, loopback but not allowing me online. why
What happens when you 'ping' external hosts? Do you get an 'operation not permitted'?
what's steps again to ping
ping <ip address>
It's a shell command
thats in network  settings i'll do it again
i put in my friends ip and press ping in the "network tools" and nothing comes in the box below. odd though under devices it shws ip address, netmask, hardware loopback and the packets are counting
Can you perform the ping from the command line?
sorry what's command
Open a terminal window, then type in 'ping <ip address>'
brb by the way my other linux box is nic my daughter is hpna, have u heard of other problms?
You need to provide more information to diagnose a hardware problem, if you suspect that to be the case
network unreachable
Ok. What's your IP address and netmask again? Are you behind a router on a home network?

ip 127.0.0.1, netmask 255.0.0.0, behind a home ntwk / router. sbc/pacbell  (hpna) home portal. my wife is conn usb to modem router, I am conn etho, daught well in xp usb adapter to phone line but linux won't register usb adapter
127.0.0.1 is the loopback interface; it wouldn't be an Ethernet interface at all
thanks i was just thinking if my wife and i ip starts with 172 shouldn't daughters. so teh 127 is the address for the network right so i have to put in her ip huh? how?
No--127.0.0.1 is "myself", or "the local computer". This address is always present for testing (even when you're not connected to anything). Your actual Ethernet interface is something else
thanx so linux see the adapter then right?
No, you're looking at the wrong interface
Try GNOME menu -> System -> Administration -> Network settings  instead
brb
